title:
Dynamic constructions of hyperbolisms of plane curves: an automated
  exploration of geometric loci
abstract:
Hyperbolism of a given curve with respect to a point and a line is an
interesting construct, a special kind of geometric locus, not frequent in the
literature. While networking between two different kinds of mathematical
software, we explore various cases, involving quartics, among them the
so-called Kuelp quartic and topologically equivalent curves, and also an
example with a sextic and a curve of degree 12. By a similar but different way,
we derive a new construction of a lemniscate of Gerono. First, parametric
equations are derived for the curve, then we perform implicitization Groebner
bases packages and using elimination. The polynomial equation which is obtained
enables to check irreducibility of the constructed curve.
